content.question: An insulated cylinder with a movable piston contains an ideal gas. The gas is allowed to expand freely, pushing the piston to the right, as shown in the figure. What happens to the internal energy of the gas as a result?

choices.label: The internal energy remains the same.
The internal energy may increase or decrease depending on the initial temperature of the gas.

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
